fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23105].
  {panel}

Google provide service to draw briliant charts
http://code.google.com/intl/ru-RU/apis/chart/

I'we tried to use it in Confluence
I put inside {HTML} HTML example from
http://code.google.com/intl/ru-RU/apis/chart/interactive/docs/quick_start.html
and got nothing

But if I open page in Preview mode - chart appearing.

What wrong with google chart inside HTML macros ?
fields.summary: Google Chart does not work in HTML macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23100].
  {panel}

Since we started adding new not-null or multi-column constraints to existing data, we've been unable to cleanly upgrade customer data if it is imported via a XML backup restore. We need to fix this so we don't have to tell customers that their XML backups are no good for upgrades.

Affected tables include:
 * cwd_memberships (new in 3.5, new constraints in 3.5.6)
 * CONTENT_PERM and CONTENT_PERM_SET (new constraints in 3.5.2, 3.5.12)
 * BANDANA (new constraints in 3.5.9)
fields.summary: Repair constraint violations while restoring from backup
TOC Makro interprets Feed's content and extends TOC
Errors during Wiki Content Migration need to specify location of problematic data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23078].
  {panel}

When a users creates a new space then default space permissions will be set.

We allow all of our users to create new spaces. Most of them have never seen the SpaceAdmin->Permissions page.
And Most of them do not read the "You can customize these permissions once the space is created." in the creation page.

The "Home" page of the new space could include a short description for the space admin like "Welcome to your new space. You can change permissions and other settings in the Space Admin area. See \[Link to Confluence Documentation\] for more details". The creator could remove this message by editing the page. He would be forced to read that.
fields.summary: Space Creation: Tell how to configure permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23073].
  {panel}

Confluence does not currently support connecting to load-balanced AD servers.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+Management+Limitations+and+Recommendations
About half-way down:

"#3. Synchronising with AD servers behind a load balancer is not supported. As with synchronising between two different AD servers, Microsoft Active Directory does not replicate the uSNChanged attribute across instances. For that reason, we do not support connecting to different AD servers even when they are load balanced. You will need to select one server (preferably one that is local) to synchronise with instead of using the load balancer."

Many companies have a single DNS entry (mydomain.mycompany.com) that points to a load balancer that directs traffic to one of many directory servers.  (Or, some companies might use DNS round robin.)  However, neither the use of DNS round robin nor use of an actual load balancer is supported by Confluence -- both approaches to load balancing direct traffic to different servers, which would violate limitation #3 above.
Currently, Confluence only supports connecting to a single directory server, not different (load-balanced) servers.
fields.summary: Support load-balanced LDAP/AD servers with Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23063].
  {panel}

Currently the following warning that comes from the add-on is only available in English language:
!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/170494211/OCFirefoxAddOnWarning.png?version=1&modificationDate=1226287182160!

It'd be good if we can internationalise, so that customers that use other language can benefit that as well.

h5. Workaround:
# Download [webdav_launcher-1.0.5-fx.xpi|https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/downloads/file/119556/webdav_launcher-1.0.5-fx.xpi]
# Open it in WinRAR or any archive manager (to auto update the archive). Otherwise, you can refer to [this guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+Files+within+JAR+Archives]
# Modify the messages in webdav_launcher-1.0.5-fx.xpi/components/*URLLauncher.js*
# Reinstall the add-on in Firefox
fields.summary: Support More Language in WebDAV Launcher Firefox Add-on
Creating new issue with JIRA Issues macro should provide choice of both "Affected Version" and "Fix Version"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23061].
  {panel}

Uploading a large plugin or large attachment causes an error using HSQL v2 or data truncation using an older version of HSQL.  The maximum size that can be stored using the current configuration is 16 MB.  

The current Hibernate->HSQL dialect maps blobs to longvarbinary types. These have a max size of 16MB. I think we can either change the dialect or configure HSQL to map longvarbinary types to blobs.

From the HSQLDB docs:
"You can set LONGVARBINARY to map to BLOB, with the sql.longvar_is_lob connection property or the SET DATABASE SQL LONGVAR IS LOB TRUE statement." 

Not sure which is easier to do.
fields.summary: Can't install a plugin or upload an attachment > 16MB using HSQL for evaluation
Add the ability for plugins to add custom contentTypes to Confluence search
Apostrophe on username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23042].
  {panel}

Using confluence 4 on EAC I create a page and add the JIRA issue macro as a gadget.  If you define the "JIRA field columns to display" using a list with spaces in it then no values are returned.  For example:

type, key, summary

The above will only show key types, every other field returned is blank.

If the spaces are removed from the above example then all the correct information is displayed.

Please could you either fix the JIRA macro to accept a comma separated list with spaces, or make the text explaining the format explicitly say to specify a comma separated list without spaces.

Thank you
John Stevenson.
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro: spaces in "JIRA field columns to display" prevents content from retrieved issues being displayed using

Add date parameter type to Macro Browser property editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23032].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a clean instance of Confluence 3.5.x.
2. Start up.  Notice the dashboard has terms like favourite.
3. Install the enUS langauge pack from plugins.atlassian.com.
4. Admin> Language> change the default language to English (United States).
5. Navigate to dashboard.  Notice things are unchanged (favourite)

Steps to mitigate
1. Shutdown Confluence.
2. Add -Dconfluence.browser.language.enabled=false to JAVA_OPTS
3. Restart Confluence.
4. Profit.  

Expected behavior: When presented with "English" as preferred browser language, prioritize based on choice in Admin>Language.
fields.summary: Language detection cannot differentiate between enUK vs enUS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23006].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
With the small size of thumbnails, when there's only one single thumbnail image in the middle of text on a page, it's often hard to tell it's an image. And the visual presentation is somewhat strange. 

*What we do currently:*
Add the text 'click to enlarge' manually as part of an image title as shown in the screen capture.

*Improvements:*
* Thumbnails are displayed with a magnifier on top automatically. 
* One step further: Users can view the original image by hovering the mouse over thumbnails after a certain amount of time, say 0.5 or 1 sec, instead of having to click them.
fields.summary: Thumbnails should display "Click to enlarge" or a magnifier icon on top of images automatically
Office Connector umbrella issues that affect stability
Import Word Document using Split by heading table of contents should preserve heading hierarchy
Provide a facility to bulk manage orphaned pages
Manage group UI should disable the remove user icon when the user is not directly in the group
Expiration Dates for pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22983].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When Confluence send an email from an user update its from field is sent this way:
"Name Surname (admin@confluence.com)"

This leads some users to reply to the email hoping it will reach the user but actually this will go to the email configured with Confluence mail server.

h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence should send an email with the correct email from the user and not the admin email or allow the user to configure the "from" field.
fields.summary: Mail server gives misleading information on From Name and From Address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22981].
  {panel}

Confluence Dashboard doesn't get updated even after a re-index/re-index from scratch.

The following appears in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code} 
Job (DEFAULT.IndexQueueFlusher threw an exception.
org.quartz.SchedulerException: Job threw an unhandled exception. [See nested exception: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667]
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool$1.run(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:14)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withBatchUpdate(LuceneConnection.java:409)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.processTasks(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.flushQueue(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:128)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor826.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy39.flushQueue(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.IndexQueueFlusher.executeJob(IndexQueueFlusher.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.surroundJobExecutionWithLogging(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.executeInternal(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:46)
	at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:199)
	... 2 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:346)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.LuceneConnectionBackedIndexTaskPerformer.perform(LuceneConnectionBackedIndexTaskPerformer.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager$BatchUpdateAction.perform(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:361)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withBatchUpdate(LuceneConnection.java:405)
	... 19 more
Caused by: org.apache.lucene.store.LockObtainFailedException: Lock obtain timed out: SimpleFSLock@D:\confluence-home\index\write.lock
	at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:85)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.init(IndexWriter.java:1562)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.<init>(IndexWriter.java:1118)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:327)
	... 22 more
{code}
Also, this may happened if you have an insufficient disk space. One of the contributors to this is scheduled daily backup, which can turn out to be large.

h5. Workaround
Delete {{write.lock}} from {{<confluence-home>/index/}}. If that only helps temporarily, check your Confluence home directory for any insufficient disk space. Please also refer to [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException+Couldn%27t+open+writer+on+directory].

*Update for Confluence 5.3.1:*
The {{write.lock}} file is now removed from {{<confluence-home>/index/}} and {{<confluence-home>/index/edge/}} during a restart. Please, let us know if you are still experiencing this problem in 5.3.1 and newer versions.
fields.summary: Confluence Dashboard doesn't get updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22972].
  {panel}

The user currently embed some Youtube videos in some of his Confluence pages using the Widget Connector.

The Youtube allows a lot of parameters such as rel=0 and showinfo=0 for example but the wiget connector can only get one parameter for time. 

I reproduced the same steps that user did in my instance and occur the same error:

In Example 01: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE} - is the simplest case since it passes no parameters to YouTube.

In Example 02: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&rel=0} - passes the rel=0 parameter to YouTube. This parameter tells YouTube to not include the "related videos" at the end of the video.

In Example 03: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&showinfo=0} - passes the showinfo=0 parameter to YouTube. This parameter tells YouTube to not place the video title on the opening still image.

In Example 04: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&showinfo=0&rel=0} - passes both the rel=0 and showinfo=0 parameters to YouTube. But, in this case, you can see (by fast-forwarding to the end of the video_ that the rel=0 parameter does not appear to have been passed to YouTube.

In Example 05: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&rel=0&showinfo=0} - passes showinfo=0 and rel=0 (in reversed order) to YouTube. Again, in the case, the showinfo=0 parameter appears to be passed, but but the rel=0 parameter.

After this tests, it seems like Confluence is only passing one parameter to youtube (only the first).
fields.summary: Youtube widget doesn't support more than one parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22968].
  {panel}

Creating a groups with a nested groups which is not included in the search filter would not mapped the user correctly.
This would result to unnecessary group management.

*How to reproduce*

Create a groups called "rootgroup". Member of this groups is two groups called

* "group1"
* "group2"

If the search filter of the group is {{(&(objectCategory=Group)(cn=rootgroup))}} the users of "group1" and "group2" will not be mapped to "rootgroup"

The ability to mapped the users of "group1" and "group2" would result to simplified group management which would helps a lot when you have a lot of groups.
fields.summary: Nested groups works only when the groups is retrieved by Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22952].
  {panel}

Description: Current HTTP headers do not contain the X-FRAME-Option, which helps prevents against Clickjacking attacks. A Clickjacking attack is similar to CSRF in which attacker can hijack a "click" on a web application from another "invisible" frame in the browser. Essentially, an attacker can force a user to click on a button that is invisible to him/her.

Exploit Scenario: An attacker crafts a malicious page such that when their victim clicks, they are actually clicking on the link or button in the vulnerable application hosted in an iframe. Thus, an attacker tricks the user into performing an action of the attacker's choosing by directing mouse input to the target application.

Short Term Solution: There are 2 options in the HTTP response header for projection, include:

DENY: If the header contains the DENY option, then the response will not be loaded within a frame.
SAMEORIGIN: If the header contains the SAMEORIGIN option, the response will be loaded within a frame only if the parent page is from the same origin.

Examples below:

Apache:
Add this to your httpd.conf:
Header always append x-frame-options SAMEORIGIN

Note that this is not a panacea for clickjacking.

SAMEORIGIN should be safe to use. See also [JST-5291|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5291?focusedCommentId=47107&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-47107]
fields.summary: Enable X-FRAME-Option in HTTP response headers in order to provide clickjacking protection
Delegated Crowd connector for Embedded Crowd with support for non-Local Groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22933].
  {panel}

The Firefox WebDAV plugin currently only automatically associates the {{.doc}} file format. This causes it to do nothing when a user clicks on "Edit in Office" or "Edit in Word" links that point to files with the following extensions:
* ppt
* pptx
* ppsx
* pot
* potx
* pptm
* docx
* dot
* dotx
* xls
* xlt
* xlsx
* xlst
* xlsm

It would be ideal if the programs that handled all these files were added automatically when installing the WebDAV plugin.

h3. Workaround

Manually add each extension and the path to the program that should handle it to the plugin by going to Tools > WebDAV Launcher Options.
fields.summary: Firefox WebDAV plugin does not automatically associate with most Office file types
Improve functionality for copying text blocks within {code} macro for IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22917].
  {panel}

Talking to Matt Ryall today, he had a dev docs improvement suggestion.

(Matt Ryall): ultimately, we need to have reference docs for those extension points, which should link out to a proper tute
(Matt Ryall): by "them", I mean "Extending the V2 search API" and "Searching using the V2 Search API"

These two pages require reference documentation and tutorials:

1. Searching using the V2 Search API
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Searching+using+the+V2+Search+API

2. Extending the V2 search API
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Extending+the+V2+search+API

These would be a useful addition to the developer documentation for Confluence.
fields.summary: Create Tutorials and Reference Documentation for "V2 Search API" Confluence Extension Points
Add 'get/setAttribute' to allow Objects to be stored in ConversionContext
Improve appearance of personal_space_12.jpg icon by making it transparent
Allow migration from the internal directory to an internal with LDAP auth directory
Allow custom macro image placeholders to be less than 26px
User wants to raise similar issues on different editing sessions
HTML export for multiple spaces or entire wiki, with links between spaces
Should have an add status update button/field on the Status Updates tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22887].
  {panel}

The UI for setting the e-mails is difficult to read and understand. The wording of the settings is too vague and both the "watches" and "all content" are in a single list making it confusing. See the attached screenshot from Confluence 3.5.7.

It would be good to have separate sections for subscriptions and notification settings. Maybe something like this:

{quote}
*Subscriptions*

* Receive a daily digest of all changes
* Receive notifications for changes made by people in your network
* Receive notifications for all new blog posts

*Automatic watching*

* Automatically watch content you edit or comment on

*Notifications*

Notification type: *HTML* | +Text+

* Include the changed content in the e-mail (HTML only)
* Include the entire content in the e-mail (HTML only)
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve UI for email notification settings and subscriptions
Schedule syncs to external sources such as LDAP for specific times rather than intervals
Allow forced shutdown of Confluence by configuring CATALINA_PID in standalone distribution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22879].
  {panel}

In Tomcat 6.0.32, I get the following errors when shutting down Confluence, even after CONF-21385 is resolved:

{noformat}
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearReferencesJdbc
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] registered the JDBC driver [org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCDriver] but failed to unregister it when the web application was stopped. To prevent a memory leak, the JDBC Driver has been forcibly unregistered.
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearReferencesJdbc
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] registered the JDBC driver [com.mysql.jdbc.Driver] but failed to unregister it when the web application was stopped. To prevent a memory leak, the JDBC Driver has been forcibly unregistered.
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearReferencesJdbc
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] registered the JDBC driver [org.postgresql.Driver] but failed to unregister it when the web application was stopped. To prevent a memory leak, the JDBC Driver has been forcibly unregistered.
2011-07-12 10:37:59,842 INFO [main] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextDestroyed Stopping Confluence
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearReferencesThreads
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] appears to have started a thread named [com.google.common.base.internal.Finalizer] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak.
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearThreadLocalMap
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] created a ThreadLocal with key of type [com.atlassian.core.logging.ThreadLocalErrorCollection$2] (value [com.atlassian.core.logging.ThreadLocalErrorCollection$2@2dc4df0b]) and a value of type [java.lang.Boolean] (value [false]) but failed to remove it when the web application was stopped. This is very likely to create a memory leak.
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearThreadLocalMap
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] created a ThreadLocal with key of type [java.lang.ThreadLocal] (value [java.lang.ThreadLocal@580f62a6]) and a value of type [org.dom4j.DocumentFactory] (value [org.dom4j.DocumentFactory@5a15ad74]) but failed to remove it when the web application was stopped. This is very likely to create a memory leak.
Jul 12, 2011 10:37:59 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearThreadLocalMap
SEVERE: The web application [/confluence] created a ThreadLocal with key of type [com.atlassian.confluence.concurrent.ThreadLocalMap] (value [com.atlassian.confluence.concurrent.ThreadLocalMap@452ec8e0]) and a value of type [java.util.HashMap] (value [{}]) but failed to remove it when the web application was stopped. This is very likely to create a memory leak.
log4j:ERROR LogMananger.repositorySelector was null likely due to error in class reloading, using NOPLoggerRepository.
Jul 12, 2011 10:38:00 AM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol destroy
INFO: Stopping Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8080
Disconnected from server
{noformat}

Those "SEVERE" and "ERROR" lines ideally wouldn't be there. It's Tomcat pointing out how some of our code and some of our library code doesn't clean up resources properly.

There's also [a race condition in C3P0|http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&aid=1795823&group_id=25357&atid=383690] that leads to error messages like this at shutdown:

{noformat}
Exception in thread "Timer-0" java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.mchange.v2.log.log4j.Log4jMLog$Log4jMLogger.isLoggable(Log4jMLog.java:257)
at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$CheckIdleResourcesTask.run(BasicResourcePool.java:1961)
at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Unknown Source)
at java.util.TimerThread.run(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Reduce errors logged when shutting down Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22875].
  {panel}

By default, web sudo and other password confirmation features in Confluence 3.5 and later are disabled if a custom authenticator is detected. However, there is an override flag that was added as part of CONF-20958 that allows administrators to turn it on again.

If it is turned on manually, in most cases it won't work properly. When user is required to confirm the password, Confluence always checks the entered password against the internally stored user/password. If an instance is configured to use custom authentication which is different from atlassian-user, the password validation will fail.

*Technical notes*

The reason behind this is that there is no public {{authenticate(String username, String password)}} method in [Seraph's Authenticator interface|http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-seraph/0.38/apidocs/com/atlassian/seraph/auth/Authenticator.html] that can be used to determine whether a user's password is valid, so Confluence just looks at its internal user management system.

We could potentially use [Authenticator.login()|http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-seraph/0.38/apidocs/com/atlassian/seraph/auth/Authenticator.html#login%28javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest,%20javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String%29], but that has a number of side-effects in the Confluence code, including logging out the user if the web sudo authentication fails. That would not be desirable.

Given the difficulty of changing Seraph's primary interface and updating all the implementations, this is unlikely to be an easy issue to resolve.
fields.summary: Support web sudo and other password confirmation features with custom authenticators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22828].
  {panel}

1) I can "add a page"
2) I can click on "edit"
3) in this editing mode, rich text is set by default
  a) I CAN'T change it to "mark up", view any "icons" or "preview"
  b) I CAN write text in the box
  c) I CAN click on "save" BUT nothing of what I've written is on the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22779].
  {panel}

Currently, search weighting is not user-configurable.

This is a request to give users control over the search weighting via the web interface.

h3. Workaround (Only applicable to Confluence 3.5.13 until 5.1.x)

* Extract the indexingSubsystemContext.xml file from the confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-X.X.X.jar
* Place the indexingSubsystemContext.xml file in your confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory
* Edit the indexingSubsystemContext.xml file's contentBoostPostProcessor section, adjusting the weighting as required.
* Restart Confluence and issue a full reindex of content to update the weighting in the index.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of Lucene search result weighting
DefaultUserAccessor.addMembership returns incorrect exception when group does not exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22773].
  {panel}

Crowd has different docs for different LDAP directory type, eg. 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Sun+Directory+Server+Enterprise+Edition+%28DSEE%29
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/OpenLDAP
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Microsoft+Active+Directory

and some others.

While Confluence has only one doc for a catchall: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory

We should make Crowd's doc available to Confluence as well.

We can't straight copy Crowd's docs however since they contain screenshot specific only to Crowd. But the available functionality should be the same.
fields.summary: Include relevant parts of Crowd's LDAP documentation in Confluence's DOC space
Add Comments when Viewing Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22768].
  {panel}

It would be great if one could convert an already uploaded Word Doc attachment into a Confluence page. I can think of a couple possible ways:

1) when viewing attachments, add an item next to certain Document attachments (along with Properties, Remove, Edit in Office, View) that says "Convert to Page" or just "Convert" then use the "doc import" engine to convert the already existing attachment to a confluence page, so that one doesn't have to re-upload, or download and then re-upload the document. User would then be asked if it should be a child page or a sibling page to the current one. 

2) in the Import Word Document area,  instead of just a "browse" button for uploading, have an "import from attachments" icon that pulls up the page location box, so one can search, go to recently viewed, or browse to the attachment, select it, and then choose to make it a child or sibling of the current page.

This way, if someone has already uploaded a bunch of docs, but really wants people to comment on them, or especially edit them but within confluence, they can easily be converted to confluence pages.
fields.summary: Import or Convert Doc Attachment to Page
Bug in DefaultI18n bean escaping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22763].
  {panel}

CONF-4289 asked that comments for pages be appended to the searchable text of each page.  I suggest that this behavior either be removed or significantly improved.  It's confusing to our users when searching to have seemingly unrelated text abruptly appended to each search result.  It's even more confusing when the comment text does not include any relevant keywords for the search.

I do not have any suggestions for how to make this look better as I'm not aware of the abilities and limitations of Confluence's search library, and I'm also not a UI designer.  But if possible do as many of the following as possible:

1. Make it clear that the comment text is comment text.  Use colors, line breaks, delimiters, hover-text, etc.
2. Only show comment text if the content of the comment is relevant to the search
fields.summary: Distinguish version comment content from page content when showing it in search results
Make Support Zip Files Downloadable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22761].
  {panel}

Use Cases, as they're described by Alistair Cockburn, relies heavily on numbered lists and requires some features, that currently not supported by Confluence:
* Specifying offset for numbering (e.g. start list from "2." for offset 2)
* Specifying arbitrary prefix for an item (e.g. "2-6a.", "2-6b." with prefix "2-6")
* Defining format of the numbered list for specific level (whether it'll be "1.2.3. or  "1.a.i.")

I've attached a file with one of the classical examples of Use Case in Fully Dressed format to give you an impression on what's supposed to be possible to achieve.
fields.summary: Extend numbered lists supports in Confluence to accomodate Use Case definition
Make it possible to search everything within the admin section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22755].
  {panel}

Currently if you do a search for users, the Find Users screen will return User, Full Name & Email.
It would be great if it also returned the user's groups (like JIRA).
This would be great when trying to export whole user list.

I recently attended Summit 2011 and spoke with Confluence Developer (I think it was @Matt Ryall) and suggested adding a New Features request.  So here I am!

FYI: JIRA can display at least 7 groups...at the Summit Matt mentioned maybe limiting to first 5 with More... display.  I'm thinking JIRA will return all the groups a user is a member.  That would be ideal.
fields.summary: Display User's Groups in Find User Screen
